column4: everyone.... I wanted to upgrade to 5.10 using this adress: http://darkstar.ist.utl.pt/ubuntu/5.10/ , how can I add it to the repositories? Can anyone please tell me??
I wanted to upgrade to 5.10 using this adress: http://darkstar.ist.utl.pt/ubuntu/5.10/ , how can I add it to the repositories? Can anyone please tell me??
why not use the official repositories?
in Portugal we have international download limits, and it would be very costy to donwload it from a non-portuguese website!
ok. isnt there an official pt.archive.ubuntu.com avaitable?
I don't think so
can you paste your surces.list to pastebin?
there arent any packages in http://darkstar.ist.utl.pt/ubuntu/5.10, only ISOs
all the lines like deb ftp://ftp.rnl.ist.utl.pt/ubuntu/ hoary universe........
have you tried changing each from hoary to breezy?
try it, either its safe, or breezy aint on there.
perhaps you didn't understand my question... is it safe to use the new version? Will it keep my ssh open, as it is now?
should do no problem yeah, you connecting to it now via ssh?
^^which means it only breaks things we know about ;)
I connect from university to my house by ssh, so that I don't spend much of my internet limit! :D
hehe. down wth restrictions and facsism in general !!!
it should be ok...... though it will restart the ssh server at some point during upgrade.
it's really dumb... in portugal, we can only download 1~2 international GB per month, depending on the connection
http://pt.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ does exist....
but it doesnt have a .pt dns ending. so might not be considered noninternational
keep yourmirrors, change all instances of hoary to breezy in your sources.list and apt-get update like a linux addict :)
good.   update then upgrade, and do it from within screen, that way tou can disconnect ssh and reconnect :)
